intro: Synotis penninervis, commonly known as the narrow-veined synotis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and palmate leaves with finely veined foliage. Its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers are typically pink or purple and bloom in clusters. Synotis penninervis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
